page.title: 14GREAT MEOLS:CHANGING SCENES.
page.content: In an interview with Gillian Farrer } (11) Mrs. Whylie of "The Elms"(ref.pg. 18) recalls the following changes: {"Very many changes,yes,very many,very {built up and to my way of thinking not {as nice.There have been several things {like farms demolished for the building {plots, little cottages and fishermen's {cottages in the sand hills and they {were very picturesque" In reply to questions on schooldays:- {"....and she was a Headmistress called {Mrs.--- a fabulous teacher,and woe {betide you if you didn't know what she {told you.She used to cane people and {you had to remember all she said and {recite all sorts of things.....and she {knitted all types of things,I think {she was the fastest you ever saw .It {was the time of The Great War, she was {always knitting balaclavas and socks {for the soldiers in the trenches."
